name: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. Joseph A. SURRICHIO, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Office of Disciplinary Counsel v. Surrichio
docket_number: No. 689 Disciplinary Docket No. 2; Disciplinary Board No. 93 DB 89

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
LARSEN and FLAHERTY, JJ., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this matter.
parties: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. Joseph A. SURRICHIO, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Rule to Show Cause entered by this Court on April 3, 1991, is discharged. It is ORDERED that respondent be and he is suspended from the Bar of this Commonwealth for a period of three years, retroactive to September 11, 1989, and he shall comply with all the provisions of Rule 217, Pa.R.D.E. It is further ORDERED that respondent shall pay costs to the Disciplinary Board pursuant to Rule 208(g), Pa.R.D.E.
LARSEN and FLAHERTY, JJ., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this matter.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Edward J. Tuite, Wayne, for respondent.
Samuel D. Miller, III, Asst. Disciplinary Counsel, Norris-town, for petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
615 A.2d 733
OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. Joseph A. SURRICHIO, Respondent.
No. 689 Disciplinary Docket No. 2.
Disciplinary Board No. 93 DB 89.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Oct. 22, 1992.
Decided Nov. 13, 1992.
Edward J. Tuite, Wayne, for respondent.
Samuel D. Miller, III, Asst. Disciplinary Counsel, Norris-town, for petitioner.
Before NIX, C.J., and ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
